intro: Roella ciliata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser ciliate roella, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with ciliate margins, giving it its common name. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. This variety is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to moist, nutrient-rich soils.
